meanings.definition: A vertical structure typically made of brick or stone used to enclose or divide an area.
meanings.sent1: The tall wall separated the two yards.
meanings.sent2: She leaned against the wall while waiting for her friend.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the wall but failed.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like a wall, impossible to break through.
meanings.sent5: The ancient wall stood strong against time's passage.

meanings.definition: A continuous vertical brick or stone structure that encloses or divides an area.
meanings.sent1: The long wall stretched across the entire field.
meanings.sent2: The wall surrounding the garden kept the rabbits out.
meanings.sent3: The wall seemed to whisper secrets to the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a wall blocking any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The sturdy wall protected the castle from invaders.

meanings.definition: A high vertical surface or barrier that encloses or divides an area.
meanings.sent1: The sheer wall of the cliff was daunting to climb.
meanings.sent2: The wall of fog obscured the view of the valley.
meanings.sent3: The wall of sound from the concert was deafening.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a wall of warmth in the cold room.
meanings.sent5: The wall of trees shielded the house from the wind.

meanings.definition: To enclose or divide an area with a wall.
meanings.sent1: They decided to wall off the garden to protect it from animals.
meanings.sent2: He will wall the backyard to create a private space.
meanings.sent3: She tried to wall her emotions but they spilled out.
meanings.sent4: The artist walled off a section of the room for his workspace.
meanings.sent5: The villagers walled the city to defend against attacks.
